Ethics, Privacy, and Compliance

  1. Introduction Why ethics and privacy matter in AI-assisted research. Relationship to reproducibility, trust, and public accountability.

  2. Core Ethical Principles Transparency, accountability, fairness, and beneficence. Avoiding harm and minimizing bias. Human oversight and interpretability.

  3. Data Privacy and Security Handling sensitive data (EHR, images, human subjects). FERPA / HIPAA / GDPR implications for AI workflows. Secure data environments at U-M (Armis2, Lighthouse, Great Lakes).

  4. Bias, Fairness, and Representation Sources of bias in training data and algorithms. Auditing model outputs. Strategies for equitable dataset design.

  5. Research Governance and Institutional Oversight Role of IRB and data use agreements. AI accountability frameworks (ISO/IEC 42001, NIST AI RMF). U-M ethics and compliance offices (Research Integrity, ITS, HITS).

  6. Case Studies Example of bias propagation (e.g., clinical AI misclassification). Example of privacy leak from an LLM training corpus.

  7. Practical Guidelines Checklist for ethical AI use in research. Documentation templates for AI tool use.

  8. Reflection

The role of researchers as stewards of responsible AI adoption.
